result.execSummary:
The defendant Teegan E. Lehr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Early termination of probation after 2 years, if there are no violations.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $25.82 and restitution surcharge.
--------------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
--------------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
--------------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with Wal-Mart.
--------------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATION OF THE RULES OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
--------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.
-------------------------------------- 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
--------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
--------------------------------------

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before 11/15/2016 at 8:00 a.m.and with work release privileges.  Conditional jail time can be served in Kenosh County.
Complete forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered WITHOUT buyout option.
